intro: Whalleya proluta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved whalleya, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a red or purple throat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Whalleya proluta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
